016package org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain;
017
018import java.io.BufferedReader;
019import java.io.IOException;
020import java.io.InputStreamReader;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.stream.Collectors;
024import org.springframework.core.io.ClassPathResource;
025import org.springframework.core.io.Resource;
026
027/**
028 * Utility methods for strings and grammars.
029 *
030 * @author Dominik Kopczynski
031 * @author Nils Hoffmann
032 */
033public final class StringFunctions {
034
035    public static char DEFAULT_QUOTE = '\'';
036    public static char DEFAULT_SPLIT = ',';
037
038    private StringFunctions(){};
039
040    public static String strip(String s, char c) {
041        if (s.length() > 0) {
042            int st = 0;
043            while (st < s.length() - 1 && s.charAt(st) == c) {
044                ++st;
045            }
046            s = s.substring(st, s.length());
047        }
048
049        if (s.length() > 0) {
050            int en = 0;
051            while (en < s.length() - 1 && s.charAt(s.length() - 1 - en) == c) {
052                ++en;
053            }
054            s = s.substring(0, s.length() - en);
055        }
056        return s;
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Split the provided text at {@link #DEFAULT_SPLIT} as separator, using
061     * {@link #DEFAULT_QUOTE} as the default quotation char.
062     *
063     * @param text the text to split
064     * @return the split string as a list
065     */
066    public static ArrayList<String> splitString(String text) {
067        return splitString(text, DEFAULT_SPLIT, DEFAULT_QUOTE, false);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Split the provided text at separator, respecting the quote char to not
072     * split in between quoted parts.
073     *
074     * @param text the text to split
075     * @param separator the separator to split at
076     * @param quote the quotation character
077     * @return the split string as a list
078     */
079    public static ArrayList<String> splitString(String text, char separator, char quote) {
080        return splitString(text, separator, quote, false);
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Split the provided text at separator, respecting the quote char to not
085     * split in between quoted parts. Optionally allow empty / whitespace at the
086     * end.
087     *
088     * @param text the text to split
089     * @param separator the separator to split at
090     * @param quote the quotation character
091     * @param withEmpty if true, allow empty parts
092     * @return the split string as a list
093     */
094    public static ArrayList<String> splitString(String text, char separator, char quote, boolean withEmpty) {
095        boolean in_quote = false;
096        ArrayList<String> tokens = new ArrayList<>();
097        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
098        char last_char = '\0';
099        boolean last_escaped_backslash = false;
100
101        for (int i = 0; i < text.length(); ++i) {
102            char c = text.charAt(i);
103            boolean escaped_backslash = false;
104            if (!in_quote) {
105                if (c == separator) {
106                    String sb_string = sb.toString();
107                    if (sb_string.length() > 0 || withEmpty) {
108                        tokens.add(sb_string);
109                    }
110                    sb = new StringBuilder();
111                } else {
112                    if (c == quote) {
113                        in_quote = !in_quote;
114                    }
115                    sb.append(c);
116                }
117            } else {
118                if (c == '\\' && last_char == '\\' && !last_escaped_backslash) {
119                    escaped_backslash = true;
120                } else if (c == quote && !(last_char == '\\' && !last_escaped_backslash)) {
121                    in_quote = !in_quote;
122                }
123                sb.append(c);
124            }
125
126            last_escaped_backslash = escaped_backslash;
127            last_char = c;
128        }
129
130        String sb_string_end = sb.toString();
131
132        if (sb_string_end.length() > 0 || (last_char == ',' && withEmpty)) {
133            tokens.add(sb_string_end);
134        }
135        if (in_quote) {
136            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupt token in grammar: '" + sb_string_end+"'");
137        }
138        return tokens;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Read the provided resource and split it at default new line characters
143     * into a list for each line.
144     *
145     * @param resource the resource to read
146     * @return a list of line strings
147     */
148    public static List<String> getResourceAsStringList(Resource resource) {
149        ArrayList<String> lines;
150        // read resource from classpath and current thread's context class loader
151        try (BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(resource.getInputStream()))) {
152            lines = br.lines().collect(Collectors.toCollection(ArrayList::new));
153        } catch (IOException e) {
154            //always pass on the original exception
155            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: Resource '" + resource.getDescription() + "' does not exist.", e);
156        }
157        return lines;
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Read the provided resource path, which is converted to a
162     * {@link ClassPathResource} and split it at default new line characters
163     * into a list for each line.
164     *
165     * @param resourcePath the resource path to read from
166     * @return a list of line strings
167     */
168    public static List<String> getResourceAsStringList(String resourcePath) {
169        return getResourceAsStringList(new ClassPathResource(resourcePath));
170    }
171
172    /**
173     * Read the provided resource and return it as a string.
174     *
175     * @param resource the resource to read
176     * @return the resource content as a string
177     */
178    public static String getResourceAsString(Resource resource) {
179        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
180        // read resource from classpath and current thread's context class loader
181        try (BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(resource.getInputStream()))) {
182            br.lines().forEach(line -> {
183                sb.append(line).append("\n");
184            });
185            return sb.toString();
186        } catch (IOException e) {
187            //always pass on the original exception
188            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: Resource '" + resource.getDescription() + "' does not exist.", e);
189        }
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Read the provided resource path and return it as a string.
194     *
195     * @param resourcePath the resource path to read from
196     * @return the resource content as a string
197     */
198    public static String getResourceAsString(String resourcePath) {
199        return getResourceAsString(new ClassPathResource(resourcePath));
200    }
201}
